predictions.text: At least one U.S. state will enact (bill signed into law) a statute creating a state-level “strategic bitcoin reserve” (or equivalent) that explicitly authorizes the state treasury/comptroller to hold Bitcoin as a balance-sheet asset AND appropriates or transfers at least $5 million (USD) for initial purchases, by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Governor signature + enacted session law text that (1) explicitly mentions Bitcoin/BTC, (2) authorizes a state entity (treasury/comptroller/investment board) to acquire/hold it, and (3) includes an appropriation/transfer/authorization of ≥$5,000,000 for purchases (or a clearly earmarked funding line).
evidence: CNBC (2026-01-17) reporting multiple U.S. states exploring adding bitcoin to public balance sheets: https://www.cnbc.com/2026/01/17/texas-us-states-budgets-bitcoin-crypto-strategic-reserve.html
monitoring_signals: State legislature bill trackers (TX, FL, WY, AZ, CO, OH) for “bitcoin reserve” / “digital asset reserve”
Governor press releases announcing bill signings related to digital assets
State treasury/comptroller policy statements on digital-asset holdings
Fiscal notes or appropriations tables referencing BTC purchases
predictions.rationale: Several states are already signaling intent; the key hurdle is converting exploratory proposals into enacted law with real funding attached.

predictions.text: Denmark’s government will announce a Greenland/Arctic security and critical-infrastructure package totaling at least DKK 5.0 billion in new funding (not previously budgeted), by 2026-09-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Official Danish government release (PMO, Ministry of Defence, Ministry of Finance, or parliamentary agreement text) stating new incremental funding ≥DKK 5.0B earmarked for Greenland/Arctic/High North security or critical infrastructure, explicitly described as additional/new (not merely re-labeled existing funds).
evidence: NYT (2026-01-17) on Greenland sovereignty tensions and protests: https://www.nytimes.com/2026/01/17/world/europe/greenland-denmark-protest-trump-takeover.html
CNBC (2026-01-17) on heightened Greenland dispute and tariff threats impacting NATO/trade: https://www.cnbc.com/2026/01/17/trump-greenland-tariffs-nato.html
monitoring_signals: Danish MoD announcements on Arctic surveillance, bases, or patrol assets
Parliamentary defense agreements (“forsvarsforlig”) and supplemental budgets
Greenland/Denmark joint statements on infrastructure (airports, ports, comms)
NATO/Arctic security meetings referencing Denmark/Greenland investments
predictions.rationale: Rising Greenland-related tensions increase pressure for visible Danish commitments; timing depends on budget cycles and coalition negotiations.

predictions.text: The European Commission will publish a formal document (press release + annex/list) proposing retaliatory trade countermeasures against the United States explicitly tied to U.S. threatened/imposed Greenland-related tariffs, by 2026-04-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: European Commission publication (DG Trade/Commission press release, Implementing Act proposal, or official consultation notice) that (1) explicitly references U.S. tariffs connected to Greenland dispute, and (2) includes a list of targeted U.S. products or sectors for countermeasures.
evidence: CNBC (2026-01-17) describing threatened 10%–25% tariffs on multiple European nations linked to Greenland/NATO tensions: https://www.cnbc.com/2026/01/17/trump-greenland-tariffs-nato.html
monitoring_signals: DG Trade statements referencing countermeasures, rebalancing, or anti-coercion tools
EU member-state trade minister meetings and Council conclusions
EU Official Journal publications on U.S.-linked countermeasures
Early leaks/consultations of product lists in European press
predictions.rationale: If tariff threats advance toward implementation, the EU often signals deterrence via published product lists; this hinges on escalation pace.

predictions.text: The U.S. EPA will issue a formal enforcement action (Notice of Violation, Administrative Order, or equivalent) naming xAI (or the named operator of its Memphis-area compute site) for alleged Clean Air Act or Clean Water Act noncompliance tied to data-center/onsite-power operations, by 2026-07-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: EPA Region-level or EPA headquarters public document (press release, enforcement docket entry, or posted NOV/order) that explicitly names xAI or the site operator and cites alleged violations related to permits/emissions/discharges for the Memphis-area facility supporting xAI computing operations.
evidence: CNBC (2026-01-16) on EPA rule updates potentially slowing xAI data-center expansion: https://www.cnbc.com/2026/01/16/musks-xai-faces-tougher-road-expanding-memphis-area-after-epa-update.html
monitoring_signals: EPA enforcement database updates (ECHO) for xAI/site entities
EPA Region 4/Region 6 press releases (as applicable) mentioning the facility
Local/state environmental agency permit disputes or public hearings
Community/NGO filings or complaints escalating to EPA involvement
predictions.rationale: Regulatory scrutiny is rising for power- and water-intensive compute sites; enforcement risk increases if expansion outpaces permitting compliance.

predictions.text: NASA will publicly update Artemis II to a launch date “no earlier than 2027” (NET 2027 or later) in an official schedule/budget testimony/press release, by 2026-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: NASA publication or senior-official statement (NASA.gov update, budget documents, congressional testimony, or Artemis program briefing) explicitly moving Artemis II to NET 2027 or later.
evidence: NYT (2026-01-17) describing progress milestone for Artemis II hardware rollout: https://www.nytimes.com/2026/01/17/science/nasa-artemis-ii-rocket-moon.html
monitoring_signals: NASA Artemis blog/schedule pages and program status briefings
GAO/NASA OIG reports on SLS/Orion integration and readiness
Congressional hearings where NASA leadership discusses Artemis timelines
Contractor schedule updates (Orion, EGS, SLS core stage/boosters)
predictions.rationale: Large integrated programs often slip despite milestones; formal schedule resets tend to appear in budget/testimony cycles.

predictions.text: At least two top-20 U.S. retailers by revenue (excluding Amazon and Walmart) will publicly announce general-availability deployment (not just pilot) of a customer-facing generative-AI “shopping assistant” that can recommend products AND create a cart/list, by 2026-10-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: For at least two qualifying retailers, a press release or official product announcement states the feature is broadly available to U.S. customers (web/app) and includes cart/list creation plus recommendations using generative AI/LLMs.
evidence: NYT (2026-01-17) on tech firms pushing ubiquitous retail AI and shifting competition: https://www.nytimes.com/2026/01/17/business/tech-firms-ai-retailers.html
monitoring_signals: Retailer app release notes and product blog announcements
Earnings calls mentioning rollout beyond pilot to full customer base
Partnership announcements with OpenAI/Anthropic/Google/AWS for shopping assistants
Store-support tooling expansions into customer-facing assistants
predictions.rationale: Retailers face strong incentives to deploy AI assistants for conversion/retention, but many efforts stall at pilots; GA rollouts are the meaningful threshold.

predictions.text: OpenAI will publicly announce a new financing round or capital raise (equity, convertible, or debt) with disclosed gross proceeds of at least $10.0 billion (USD), by 2026-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: OpenAI (or an SEC filing/credible wire report confirmed by OpenAI) states a completed or signed financing with disclosed proceeds ≥$10B.
evidence: Tom’s Hardware (citing analysis of OpenAI cash pressure) noting runway concerns by mid-2027: https://www.tomshardware.com/tech-industry/big-tech/openai-could-reportedly-run-out-of-cash-by-mid-2027-nyt-analyst-paints-grim-picture-after-examining-companys-finances
monitoring_signals: OpenAI blog posts or press statements about new funding
Large investor reports (Microsoft/sovereign funds) hinting at participation
Credit facility/converter rumors in major wires (Reuters/Bloomberg/WSJ)
Capex/compute contract expansions implying fresh capital needs
predictions.rationale: Frontier-model costs remain high and cash runway narratives increase fundraising likelihood; the main uncertainty is size disclosure and timing.

predictions.text: Donald Trump (personally or via an affiliated entity/campaign) will file a civil lawsuit in U.S. federal court against CBS and/or Paramount Global explicitly related to airing an interview “in full” or alleged editing/misrepresentation of that interview, by 2026-03-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: A federal court docket (PACER) shows a newly filed complaint naming CBS/Paramount as defendant(s) and the factual allegations center on the referenced interview broadcast/editing; complaint date on or before 2026-03-31 UTC.
evidence: NYT (2026-01-17) on White House legal threat toward CBS over airing an interview “in full”: https://www.nytimes.com/2026/01/17/business/media/cbs-news-trump-interview.html
monitoring_signals: PACER alerts for filings by Trump or named affiliates against CBS/Paramount
Public statements from Trump lawyers escalating from threats to litigation
Paramount legal disclosures (8-K/10-Q risk factors) referencing threatened suit
Cease-and-desist letters reported by major outlets
predictions.rationale: Escalatory rhetoric often stops short of filing; however, public legal threats sometimes progress quickly to a complaint for leverage or signaling.

predictions.text: U.S. Treasury and/or the IRS will publish official guidance implementing or clarifying the ABLE (529A) eligibility expansion to disability onset before age 46 (effective in 2026), by 2026-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: IRS/Treasury issues a Notice, Revenue Procedure, final regulations, or an official IRS.gov guidance page update explicitly stating the age-46 onset eligibility rule and operational details for ABLE programs.
evidence: MarketWatch (2026-01-17) on expanded access to investment accounts for disabled Americans without jeopardizing SSI/Medicaid: https://www.marketwatch.com/story/14-million-americans-are-getting-access-to-these-game-changing-investment-accounts-without-risking-their-supplemental-security-income-and-medicaid-benefits-afeb569d
monitoring_signals: IRS releases (Notices/Rev. Procs) mentioning 529A/ABLE
Treasury Priority Guidance Plan items related to ABLE accounts
ABLE program administrators requesting clarification on eligibility verification
SSA/Medicaid coordination guidance updates referencing ABLE changes
predictions.rationale: A statutory eligibility shift typically prompts operational guidance; timing uncertainty comes from agency bandwidth and prioritization.
